item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Installation of a New Output Relay and a GND Switch
item.description:
During the testing of a restored Beogram 4002 (5513), I discovered an intermittent issue with the output relay. Occasionally, it wouldn’t activate when the stylus made contact, blocking the audio signal from the amplifier. This was a fortunate problem since the relay is the same one used for RPM switching in the 4002 and 4000 models. item.title: Beogram 4000: Installation of a New Gold Coated DIN5 Plug and a Grounding Switch
item.description:
My restoration of the Beogram 4000 is progressing well. I’ve added a grounding switch and a new gold-plated Neutrik DIN5 plug. The switch allows users to choose between the grounding setup of the older 4000/4002 models (separate signal and system grounds) and the later 4004 models (combined grounds). This option helps prevent ground loops and the resulting humming, depending on the amplifier being used. I wrote a detailed post on this topic a while back...

item.title: Beogram 4000: Restoration and Exploration of Photocell Function in Sensor Arm
item.description:
The Beogram 4000 restoration is going well, but it appears someone attempted repairs before. The sensor arm insert, containing the light bulb and photocell for record detection, was in disarray. Upon inspection, a photocell wire was disconnected, another was damaged from being forced back into the aluminum profile, and the lens insert had heat damage, likely from improper soldering. item.title: Beogram 4000: Installation of a Grounding Switch That Allows to Connect System and Signal Grounds
item.description:
During my latest restoration of a Beogram 4000 turntable, I encountered a loud hum when playing records through my Beomaster 6000’s 4-channel phono input. The issue was resolved by connecting the signal and system grounds. item.title: Beogram 4000: Adjusting the AC Motor Voltage and Measuring the Voltage Differences Between the Phases
item.description:
During the restoration of a Beogram 4000 turntable, the AC motor requires precise adjustment. The service manual recommends setting the main phase voltage to 6V (RMS) and the frequency to 42.3 Hz for 33 RPM using an oscilloscope.
